definition: to constitute/to form/to compose/to make up/to configure (computing)
to construct/to form/to make up/to compose/literary composition/paper mulberry (Broussonetia papyrifera)
variant of 構|构[gou4]/(Tw) (coll.) variant of 夠|够[gou4]/to reach by stretching
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Learn how to handle setbacks. Life is made of ups, downs, and disappointments.
sentences.chinese: 学会如何处理挫折，生活由顺利，挫折和失望构成。

sentences.english: Electric machines are composed of stator and rotor.
sentences.chinese: 电机是由定子和转子两部分构成的。

sentences.english: The sand forms a continuous transgressive blanket .
sentences.chinese: 砂质物构成一个连续的海进盖层。

sentences.english: The popular PE is the major part of the whole career of PE.
sentences.chinese: 群众体育是构成整个体育事业的重要组成部分。

sentences.english: In a word, numerous factors contribute to the global character of Jia Pingwa's literary works.
sentences.chinese: 多种因素构成了贾平凹创作中的世界性因素。

sentences.english: Impedance transformer is one kind of main equipment of track circuit in electrification district.
sentences.chinese: 扼流变压器是电化区段构成轨道电路的主要设备之一。

sentences.english: The conflict between primitivism and anti - primitivism forms the contrary leading attitudes.
sentences.chinese: 原始和反原始构成其互为悖反的主导心态。

sentences.english: Newton's law of motion forms the foundation of classical mechanics .
sentences.chinese: 牛顿的运动定律构成传统力学的基础。

sentences.english: It is the representative power of the villagers' representatives that forms the specific basis of the village.
sentences.chinese: 正是村民代表的代表能力构成了特定的村庄基础。

sentences.english: International human-rights lawyers say these types of killings would likely constitute a war crime.
sentences.chinese: 国际人权律师说，这种杀人行为可能会构成犯罪。

sentences.english: Jiuzhaigou is a world of water, which brings Jiuzhaigou its most enchanting views.
sentences.chinese: 寨沟是水的天地，水构成了九寨沟最富魅力的景色。

sentences.english: Paper is made up of transparent fibers.
sentences.chinese: 纸是由透明纤维构成的。

sentences.english: Of long standing, Confucianism is the core of Chinese Culture.
sentences.chinese: 儒家思想渊远流长，构成中国民族文化的核心。

sentences.english: It is composed of hair follicle melanocytes are vivid.
sentences.chinese: 这是由毛囊中黑色素细胞不生动构成的。

sentences.english: The mixed pendulum is a new one which consists of a simple pendulum and a compound pendulum.
sentences.chinese: 混合摆是由单摆与复摆构成的一种新型摆。

sentences.english: It refers to the formation of new words by adding affixes to other words or morphemes.
sentences.chinese: 将词缀加入其他单词或词素以构成新词的方法。

definition: according to this/on the ground of the above/(formally introduces reported speech in writing)
to arise/to come into being/to come about/to give rise to/to bring into being/to bring about/to produce/to engender/to generate/to appear/appearance/emergence/generation/production/yield
(conjunction linking two nouns) and its .../and their .../and his .../and her ...
